❦ P O L I C I E S ❦\n\n
Please no visitors past 9:00pm.
Please be considerate of other guests during your stay by keeping the
volume on your television low, especially past 10:00pm.
Pets are not allowed in rooms.
Please no candles.
All suites are non-smoking. Violators will be charged a $300 fee.
❦ O T H E R I N F O R M A T I O N ❦
LIGHTING
As you enter the room the lighting was set on a “Welcome” scene. All of the
lighting is pre-programmed to provide four different ambiances. By each door and next
to the beds you will find the control panels. Each button is labeled for easy use.
WATER FEATURES
The water features in Hawaii, Pairs, and Rome turn on when the lights are on the
“Welcome” setting. Each of these features will turn off when the lights are “All on” or
“Off.”
The water features in Morocco and Congo have separate switches. The switch in
Morocco is to the left of the hanging tapestry. The switch in the Congo is on the wall
below the water feature.
SAUNA
Arabia and Egypt: In order for the sauna heater to work turn the knob on but must
be kept within the black area. The other numbers are for convenience to have the heater
turn on at a later pre-determined time.
For example if you want the heater to turn on in two hours set the knob on two and it will
begin to count down and once it reached the black are the heater will automatically turn
on.
PHONE CALLS
Local calls may be made by dialing 9 for an outside line. If you receive a
busy signal, wait a few minutes and try again. Long distance calls may only be made
with a phone card.

Alaska, Morocco, Athens The fireplace is controlled by the thermostat to the right

AIR CONDITIONING AND HEATING UNIT
The temperature of your suite may be regulated by adjusting the air unit. It is also
helpful to keep the air unit on fan for “white noise.”
